TestItem.Stem: According to paragraph 3, Mischel and his allies have been criticized for which of the following reasons?

Distractor_list.Distractor: They failed to recognize that a person can be consistent on certain traits even though the person might not be consistent on all traits.
They were wrong in their conclusion that people do not always behave consistently across situations.
They considered scientific research to be a more valid test of cross-situational consistency than peoples' own judgments.
They overlooked the fact that some traits are more likely than others to result in behavior that is consistent across situations.
